page.title: 18A HISTORY OF BISPHAM
page.content: Since 1418, Bispham has been an ill-defined area lying within Blackpool. Before the Romans arrived it was an area of impassable bogs. In the Domesday Book, the ancient parish of Bispham is recorded as Biscopham. The parish prospered and grew, though it was nearly wiped out by the Black Death in 1349. The first amusement centre to be built in Bispham was Uncle Tom's Cabin, mentioned on another page. Bispham has now grown into a thriving community, with its own community centre,where all kinds of people and groups meet. The bogs and barren land have been replaced by modern houses and amenities; nowadays, although it is still a part of Blackpool, it is often called Bispham Village.
